newsitem.title: USA: California school officials back tax initiative.
newsitem.headline: California school officials back tax initiative.

text.p: The Association of California School Administrators said on Tuesday it supports a measure that would keep the top state income tax brackets in place for the wealthiest one percent of California taxpayers.

Proposition 217 would provide schools and communities with $860 million in the first year and $700 million in each following year, without cutting other state or local programs and without new taxes, the association said.
The proposition, which will appear on the November 5 ballot, would continue the highest tax rates of 10 percent and 11 percent.
The association is one of the state's largest organizations of school officials.
"Proposition 217 provides new possibilities for schools by fairly generating needed revenues," said Bob Wells, assistant executive director of the 14,000-member association.
